_exec_summary.SummaryText:
The CHS Propane Terminal - Bogard complies with NFPA 58 requirements for LP-Gas storage. It is CHS' policy to comply with all applicable laws and regulations and to conduct business in a manner which protects the environment, Company employees and the general public. If an emergency were to occur, we would notify the Bogard Fire Department and request that they

respond to the emergency.



The CHS Propane Terminal - Bogard is a bulk terminal storing LPG for resale to propane marketers in the area. The facility consists of six 30,000 gallon storage tanks.



Our worst-case scenario is failure of one 30,000 gallon storage tank when filled to the greatest amount allowed (88% at 60 degrees F), resulting in a vapor cloud explosion. The resulting distance to the endpoint extends offsite, and public receptors are within the distance to the endpoint. Our alternative scenario is a piping break, in which a liquid propane pipe breaks due either liquid expansion (failure of hydrostatic valves), a pull-away (failure of breakaway devices), collision, or corrosion of the pipe. This scenario would consist of a release of approximately 184,488 pounds of propane over a ten minute period. The Risk Management Program Guidance for Propane Storage Facilities document calculated this quantity based on a 6 inch liquid propane pipe line and resulted in a 0.5 mile distance to endpoint for an overpressure of 1 psi.



This facility complies with EPA's accident prevention rule, the OSHA PSM standard and all applicable state and local codes and regulations. The propane system is designed, installed and

maintained in accordance with NFPA 58, state law and company policies.



We have never had an accident involving propane that caused deaths, injuries, property or environmental damage, evacuations or sheltering in place.



In the event of an emergency involving our propane system, it is our policy to notify the Bogard Fire Department and request that they help respond to the emergency. We hav

e coordinated our response plans with the fire department and the deputy chief has been onsite to review our construction and systems. Upon startup, members of the fire department will be trained and walked through the facility.
